Aroon Purie rings NSE bell, says it's for next chapter of India, India Today GroupIndia Today Group Chairman and Editor-in-Chief Aroon Purie on Friday rang the closing bell at the National Stock Exchange (NSE) to mark the Group's 50-year journey and said it was for the next chapter of India and the India Today Group.

NSE bell we ring today is for next chapter of India, India Today Group: Aroon PurieThe moment symbolised both a milestone for the media group and a nod to India's financial markets, which have grown alongside the Group's own evolution since 1975.

Video: NSE felicitates India Today Group Chairman Aroon Purie on 50-year milestoneNational Stock Exchange (NSE) MD & CEO Ashish Kumar Chauhan on Friday felicitated India Today Group Chairman Aroon Purie as the Group completed 50 years at a ceremony in Mumbai.

Retail inflation rises to 0.71% in November from 0.25% in OctoberFood inflation remained in deflation for the sixth straight month, but the pace of decline narrowed sharply. The Consumer Food Price Index showed a contraction of 3.91% in November, compared to a much steeper 5.02% fall in October.

India–US trade deal talks move forward, but Delhi refuses to open agriculture marketIndia has refused to allow American agricultural products into the Indian market. India believes that permitting US farm goods would increase competitive pressure on domestic farmers and reduce their income.

Unclaimed wealth is rising in India. How silence around money is costing familiesA growing number of Indian families are learning that wealth without communication can turn into confusion, conflict and costly mistakes. The solution begins long before any will is written.

Keys to new homes first, then redevelopment begins: Pranav Adani on Dharavi planPranav Adani said that the Dharavi project is finally progressing with a concrete plan to build around 2 lakh new homes, ensuring residents are moved into these units before any demolition or redevelopment of old structures begins.

entertainment.headline: Akhanda 2 box office Day 3: Balakrishna film mints Rs 60 crore in opening weekend Nandamuri Balarkrishna's Akhanda 2 minted Rs 60 crore nett in India during its opening weekend. The film zoomed past Rs 100 crore globally and is expected to continue its run.

SNL spoofs Actors on Actors in holiday edition with Grinch and Scrooge The latest episode of SNL delivered a seasonal parody of Variety's 'Actors on Actors' series, featuring holiday favourites such as the Grinch, Scrooge, and Rudolph in a comedic roundtable.

Ben Affleck reunites with Jennifer Lopez and Jennifer Garner at kids' play Actors Ben Affleck, Jennifer Lopez, and Jennifer Garner were seen at a Los Angeles school play on Friday night, supporting their children while navigating ongoing personal histories. The event follows a period of high-profile relationship changes and public scrutiny.

Good to be home: Priyanka Chopra shares sweet family moments with Nick Jonas, Malti Priyanka Chopra shared sweet photos from her time at home with husband Nick Jonas and daughter Malti Marie, showing how much she enjoys simple family moments. The pictures gave fans a warm glimpse into her personal life.

Ajith Kumar kisses Shalini ahead of Malaysia race, video goes viral Actor Ajith Kumar was seen sharing a candid kiss with his wife, Shalini, as he prepared to leave for the Asian Le Mans Series in Malaysia. The gesture was captured on video, drawing widespread attention on social media and highlighting the couple's enduring bond.

Actor Dileep's movie screening in Kerala bus stopped after woman's bold protest A protest by a woman passenger led to the discontinuation of a Dileep film screening on a Kerala State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) bus, sparking debate among passengers. This incident comes days after Dileep was acquitted in the high-profile 2017 Malayalam actor assault case.

Why today's hit songs die fast: Single Papa music composer Aman Pant responds Music composer Aman Pant created unique Nagamese sounds for 'Family Man Season 3' and composed songs for Single Papa. He reflected on music's changing landscape, the AI influence and impact of corporatisation in the industry.

Kareena Kapoor, Ajay Devgn, Tiger Shroff meet football icon Lionel Messi in Mumbai Kareena Kapoor Khan, Ajay Devgn, and Tiger Shroff were among the Indian film celebrities who met football legend Lionel Messi in Mumbai. While Kareena and her sons, Taimur and Jeh, posed with Messi in Argentina jerseys at the CCI, Ajay and Tiger met him later at the Wankhede Stadium.

Manju Warrier slams 2017 sexual assault verdict, says justice is still incomplete Manju Warrier, referring to the Kerala actor assault case, said those who committed the crime were punished but the mind that planned the act walks free. Manju is the ex-wife of actor Dileep, an accused who was acquitted.

Kerala actor's first post after assault case verdict: Lost faith in this trial court Nearly a week after the Kerala actor assault case verdict, in which actor Dileep was acquitted and six others were convicted, the survivor has shared a post for the first time, criticising the trial court.

Jacob Elordi snaps at paparazzo: You make it really hard for me to live Actor Jacob Elordi was seen in a video having a heated exchange with a photographer at a Paris train station while trying to remain low-profile. The 28-year-old conveyed his frustration, telling the persistent individual they were making his life difficult as he travelled.

Kareena Kapoor shares glimpse as sons Taimur, Jeh get Messi-ready Lionel Messi has reached Mumbai for his GOAT India Tour 2025. Besides, young players from Maharashtra, celebrities like Kareena Kapoor and her sons are also joining the celebrations.

Sonakshi Sinha slams open attack on actors, critics; wants stricter laws Actor Sonakshi Sinha publicly expressed concern over an increase in online attacks targeting both actors and film critics, describing the trend as deeply disturbing and highlighting the urgent need for stricter laws.

Karan Johar says he feels awkward eating at weddings, standing in food queues Bollywood filmmaker Karan Johar revealed during a discussion with actors Kriti Kharbanda and Pulkit Samrat that he has never eaten at a wedding. The exchange took place as they talked about wedding traditions and preferences.

Awaara, Mera Naam Joker, Prem Rog: Raj Kapoor films that still speak to India From timeless romance to social commentary, Raj Kapoor's classics continue to inspire, entertain, and resonate across generations. On his 101st birth anniversary, here's a look at some of his iconic films that still speak to us.

Wake Up Dead Man Knives Out review: Josh O'Connor owns deliciously unruly whodunitRelease Date:Fri Dec 12, 2025 Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery mixes faith, guilt and murder with Rian Johnson's trademark mischief. Daniel Craig returns as a sharper Benoit Blanc, but Josh O'Connor gives the film its emotional edge.

The Paradise: Nani teases BTS clip, celebrates director Srikanth Odela's birthday Actor Nani celebrated director Srikanth Odela's birthday with a BTS teaser for their upcoming film The Paradise. The actioner is set to release on March 26, 2026.

Akhanda 2 box office Day 2: Nandamuri Balakrishna's film nears Rs 50 crore Balakrishna Nandamuri's Akhanda 2: Thaandavam experienced a strong start at the box office, with a notable drop in collections on its second day. The film, which opened after a delayed release, is performing well across languages and is on track to cross the Rs 50 crore mark in India.

Salman Khan says he's not a great actor: I simply do what I feel in the moment At the Red Sea Film Festival 2025, Salman Khan openly discussed his own acting style, calling himself 'not a great actor'. At the fest, Khan also interacted with Idris Alba and Johnny Depp, among others.

general news.headline: Father and son behind Bondi Beach carnage that killed 15, duo reportedly from PakNew South Wales Police said the shooting, which targeted members of Sydney's Jewish community during the celebration, has been officially classified as a "terrorist attack".

Dense fog grips Delhi as AQI remains over severe, flight ops disruptedNear-zero visibility from dense fog combined with severe air pollution disrupted road traffic and delayed early morning flights in Delhi. An orange alert has also been issued by the weather department.

Who is Ahmed al Ahmed, fruitseller who tackled Sydney beach shooter at frontlineAhmed al Ahmed, a 43-year-old Sydney fruit shop owner, was shot twice after bravely tackling and disarming a gunman during a deadly attack at Bondi Beach. The targeted shooting at a Jewish Hanukkah event left at least 16 people dead and dozens injured.

Thick fog in Delhi delays PM Modi's flight for Jordan, Ethiopia and Oman tourAs dense winter fog blanketed Delhi on Monday morning, authorities were forced to delay Prime Minister Narendra Modi's departure for his three-nation tour to Jordan, Ethiopia, and Oman.

Stranded Indian begs for H-1B appointment slot: MAGA gloats, others vow helpIndians with jobs in the US are stranded in India as the Trump administration postponed H-1B interviews slated for December to March. A plea by one such person to fellow Indians on Reddit has gone viral. Though the MAGA crowd is claiming it as a sign of victory, others are vowing to help by creating visa interview slots.

Pro-democracy Hong Kong media tycoon found guilty of national security offencesHong Kong court finds media tycoon Jimmy Lai guilty of national security offences. The former Hong Kong media tycoon and a vocal critic of Beijing, was convicted on Monday in a landmark national security case that could see him spend the rest of his life in prison.

Watch: Messi and Sachin Tendulkar's 10 on 10 meet-up in MumbaiLionel Messi and Sachin Tendulkar shared a rare moment at Wankhede Stadium, exchanging memorabilia and smiles. The meeting brought together two global sporting icons during Messi's India visit.

Huge responsibility for small worker: Nitin Nabin on appointment to key BJP postNitin Nabin's appointment as BJP national working president marks a significant generational shift, emphasising dedication and grassroots organisational work. His rise reflects the party's focus on nurturing young, dynamic leaders with strong ideological roots.

H-1B, H-4 visas prudentially revoked in US amid interview delays in IndiaAmid the mass rescheduling of H-1B visa interviews in India, many US-based temporary work visa holders have reportedly received emails informing them that their visas have been "prudentially revoked". An immigration expert says many previously cleared issues are being re-reviewed.

Keep Your Little Ones Cozy This Winter with Amazon Everyday EssentialsWhether you're looking to care for little ones or find the perfect gift, this collection of baby and kids' essentials brings together nourishment, comfort, and thoughtful design.

How Indians are raising the bar at house partiesProfessional bartenders and mixologists are elevating India's house party scene. Bring one in and give your party an instant, caramel-popcorn-level glow-up. Across metros, and even in smaller cities like Jabalpur and Nagpur, you can dial a bar home at just a day's notice. And prices start at just Rs 2,000.

This incident comes days after Dileep was acquitted in the high-profile 2017 Malayalam actor assault case.

Live: Australia PM hints at tougher gun laws, ownership limits after Sydney shootingSydney Bondi Beach Shooting Live Updates: Australia is reeling from its deadliest gun attack in nearly three decades after a targeted antisemitic shooting at Sydney's Bondi Beach left many dead. Police have identified one of the gunmen as a 50-year-old man who was shot dead at the scene, while the suspected second shooter, his 24-year-old son, remains in critical condition in hospital. An ISIS flag was found in a car linked to the suspects, intensifying terrorism concerns. Authorities raided the family's home in Sydney's Bonnyrigg suburb as the investigation widened. Forty people, including two police officers, remain hospitalised, with victims ranging in age from 10 to 87. Stay with IndiaToday.com for live updates –

India Today @ 50 Part 1: Revisiting India's most turbulent decadeIndia Today Group marks its 50th anniversary with a five-part docu-series reflecting on its impactful journey in Indian journalism. The series revisits pivotal moments from 1975 to 1985, highlighting political and cultural shifts that shaped the nation.

How a 1956 German offer built India's top IITIIT Madras was established in 1959 with the support of Germans. It was the third IIT to be set up in India. The plan behind setting up IITs was to match the quality of education of institutes like MIT.

'Dhurandhar' brings their violent underworld to life on screen, where monsters, messiahs, and spies collide. Know the real stories of these men: the Dhurandhars who ruled Lyari with fear and fire.

Why Musk and Vembu are questioning the old degree model?Recently, you may have heard leaders from Elon Musk to Sridhar Vembu say there is zero need for a degree and that they are willing to hire people without one. The emphasis is on skills, which is relevant to some extent. But the real question remains: can a 22-year-old with no degree in hand truly land a job?

At least 16 people, including one of the gunmen, were killed in the attack.

Remember the names: Rahul Gandhi vows to change law guarding election commissionersRahul Gandhi accused the BJP and the Election Commission of enabling "vote theft" at a Congress rally in Delhi, vowing to repeal and retrospectively change laws he claimed were enacted to protect election commissioners.

sports.headline: A 14-year-old at the door: Why Vaibhav Suryavanshi feels ready for India debut At an age when most are still learning the game, Vaibhav Suryavanshi is forcing Indian cricket to confront an uncomfortable question: when talent arrives this early, can patience afford to wait?

Suryakumar Yadav and the unending search for form Suryakumar Yadav is now without a T20I fifty for 21 innings. When will his yearning for runs end? Can India afford out of form capyain and vice captain going into the T20 World Cup?

Arshdeep makes the ball talk in Dharamsala, dedicates POTM award to 10-year-old niece Arshdeep Singh bounced back strongly in Dharamsala, using swing and seam to outthink South Africa before dedicating his Player of the Match award to his 10-month-old niece.

Arshdeep, Varun combine as India blow away South Africa in Dharamsala IND vs SA: India completed yet another thumping win against South Africa in the 5-match T20I series. The bowling unit, led by Arshdeep Singh and Varun Chakravarthy blew away the Proteas in Dharamsala.

India wins maiden squash world cup with 3-0 victory over Hong Kong India won its first-ever Squash World Cup title with a dominant 3-0 win over Hong Kong in Chennai. The historic victory marks a new high for Indian squash and could become a watershed moment for the sport in the country.

Varun Chakaravarthy spins magic in Dharamsala, 2nd fastest Indian to 50 T20I wicketsIND vs SA, 3rd T20I: Varun Chakaravarthy delivered a clinical performance in Dharamsala, rattling South Africa's middle order and becoming the second-fastest Indian to reach 50 T20I wickets.

IND vs SA: All-round Hardik Pandya scripts history with 100 T20I wicketsIND vs SA: Hardik Pandya reached the landmark of 100 T20I wickets in the Dharamsala T20I, thereby becoming the fifth cricketer in Men's T20Is to achieve the feat. He also became the third Indian in Men's T20Is with 100 wickets.

Messi, Sachin, Chhetri: GOATs meet at Wankhede to create epic moments in MumbaiLionel Messi's GOAT tour moment saw some epic moments in Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium. The legendary Argentine meet the very best of Indian sports - Sachin Tendulkar and Sunil Chhetri and exchanged jerseys.

Bumrah misses Dharamsala T20I due to personal reasons, returns to MumbaiIndia vs South Africa, 3rd T20I: Jasprit Bumrah was unavailable for selection on Sunday due to personal reasons. The fast bowler flew to Mumbai and could miss the last two matches of the series.

Unstoppable India crush Pakistan to continue flawless run in U19 Asia CupIndia U19 extended their unbeaten run in the U19 Asia Cup with a commanding 90-run win over Pakistan in Dubai on Sunday, posting 240 and restricting their rivals to 150.

Messi's Kolkata Visit Turns Chaotic: Fans Allege Mismanagement, Vandalise Salt Lake StadiumIn this Special Report, an Unidentified speaker reports from Kolkata's Yuva Bharati Krirangan on the chaotic scenes during Lionel Messi's visit. The reporter highlights 'total mismanagement' as fans, angry over Messi's brief 'eight to nine minutes' appearance, vandalised the stadium. The transcript details how spectators threw bottles and set fire to seats meant for VVIPs, including Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee. Despite the presence of superstars Rodrigo De Paul and Luis Suarez, the event descended into a 'ruckus' with allegations of poor visibility and cancelled interactions.

Messi gets Aadhaar card from fans, Wankhede Stadium echoes with chants: See photoLionel Messi's trip to India: From Marine Drive to Wankhede, fans celebrated Messi with chants, packed local trains and even a mock Aadhaar card, underlining the extraordinary devotion surrounding his Mumbai visit on Sunday, December 14.

Messi event fiasco will hurt Kolkata for decades: Indian football chief Kalyan ChaubeyAIFF president Kalyan Chaubey slammed the West Bengal government over chaos at Lionel Messi's Kolkata event, warning poor planning could hurt the city and India's global sporting image for decades.

Two days before IPL auction, Sarfaraz Khan smashes 25-ball 64 for MumbaiSyed Mushtaq Ali Trophy: Sarfaraz Khan smashed 64 in just 25 balls, leading Mumbai's successful chase of 235 against Haryana. Sarfaraz is likely to trigger a bidding war in the IPL 2026 mini auction, scheduled in Abu Dhabi on Tuesday, December 16.

Ashes: England security guard gets involved in heated face-off with media personA confrontation unfolded at Brisbane airport when an England cricket team security official had a heated exchange with a Channel Seven cameraman during the squad's check-in for their Adelaide flight.

Insult or banter? BBL trolls Babar Azam after Pakistan batter fails on debutPakistan batter Babar Azam made a disappointing BBL debut for Sydney Sixers on December 14, scoring just two runs off five balls before being dismissed by Brody Couch, sparking online trolling.

Next Sanju Samson? Aaron George, Kerala-born Hyderabad batter, impresses vs PakistanU19 Asia Cup India vs Pakistan: Aaron George played a composed knock of 85 off 88 balls to rescue India after early setbacks in clash against Pakistan in Dubai, building crucial partnerships and drawing comparisons to Sanju Samson with his stylish strokeplay.

U19 Asia Cup: Did India, Pakistan defy ICC directive by snubbing handshake?India Under-19s maintained their no-handshake stance against Pakistan in the Asia Cup despite an ICC push for protocol, keeping the spotlight on the ongoing handshake debate as the rivals are likely to meet again later in the tournament.

Jaiswal's blistering 100 puts selectors on notice ahead of T20 World CupYashasvi Jaiswal scored a blazing century to help Mumbai chase 235 against Haryana in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. His performance intensifies calls for his inclusion in India's T20I squad amid Shubman Gill's poor form.

Watch: Vaibhav Suryavanshi's dismissal triggers frenzy in Pakistan dugoutIndia vs Pakistan, U19 Asia Cup: Pakistan fast bowler Mohammad Sayyam celebrated Vaibhav Suryavanshi's wicket in explosive fashion, while the Pakistan dug-out was equally chuffed, recognising the significance of dismissing the 14-year-old batting prodigy early on Sunday in Dubai.

Bhaichung Bhutia Slams 'VIP Culture' For Chaos At Lionel Messi's Kolkata EventFormer Indian football captain Bhaichung Bhutia has strongly criticised the mismanagement at Lionel Messi's recent event in Kolkata. Speaking on the chaos that unfolded at the Salt Lake Stadium during the 'GOAT India Tour 2025', Bhutia blamed 'VIP culture' for denying genuine fans a glimpse of the Argentine legend. He stated, 'The genuine fans did not really get to see Messi.' Bhutia noted that while organisers tried their best, the situation spiralled out of control due to the presence of unauthorised VIPs who crowded the venue. The football icon expressed hope that such mistakes would not be repeated in the future.

Cameron Green clarifies manager's IPL auction gaffe. Will it affect bidding war?Australia all-rounder Cameron Green has registered as a batter for IPL 2026 auction scheduled to be held in Abu Dhabi on December 16. Green has kept his base price at Rs 2 Crore and is expected to trigger bidding wars between franchises.

India Today's Anirban Sinha Roy Reports: VIPs Hijack Messi Event in Kolkata, Fans StrandedIn this Special Report, India Today's Anirban Sinha Roy reports on the chaotic scenes at Kolkata's Salt Lake Stadium during Lionel Messi's historic visit. The journalist highlights how 'Neta monkeys' and their associates, including actress Subhashree Ganguly, hijacked the event, leaving ordinary fans stranded outside. Roy notes that while VIPs and their families managed to click photos with the Argentine legend, genuine ticket-holders were denied a glimpse. The broadcast also covers the political fallout, with the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) demanding the resignation of the West Bengal Sports Minister over the mismanagement. The report underscores the stark contrast between the 'passion' of the fans and the 'privilege' of the ruling class.

Messi lost his cool, was frustrated: First-hand witness recalls Kolkata chaosFormer India midfielder Lalkamal Bhowmick said Messi appeared visibly unsettled during the GOAT Tour event at Kolkata's Vivekananda Yuvabharati Stadium, prompting security to step in and cut short his appearance on Saturday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
